Cass Ave., Bldg 240 Argonne, IL 60439 E-mail: hguo [at] anl [dot] gov CV | DBLP | Google Scholar | ResearchGate | GitHub | Hanqi Guo is a computer scientist and specializing in visualization, analysis, and machine learning for scientific data. He is an awardee of the DOE Early Career Research Program in 2022. He has received the best paper awards in IEEE VIS, IEEE PacificVis, and ChinaVis, premier conferences in the visualization research community. Please see my curriculum vitae for more details. I am constantly seeking for outstanding persons for PhD students and PostDocs in my group. Candidates are encouraged to send CV, transcript(s), and statement of research interests to guo.2154 [at] osu [dot] edu. Awards Best Paper Award, IEEE LDAV, 2025 Best Paper Award, IEEE IPDPS, 2025 Awardee, DOE Early Career Research Program (ECRP), 2022 Best Paper Honorable Mention, IEEE VIS, 2022 Best Short Paper Honorable Mention, IEEE VIS, 2021 Best Paper Award, IEEE PacificVis, 2021 Best Paper Award, IEEE VIS, 2019 Best Paper Honorable Mention, IEEE LDAV, 2018 Outstanding Postdoctoral Performance Award in Basic Research, Argonne National Laboratory, 2017 Best Paper Honorable Mention, SIGGRAPH Asia Symposium on Visualization, 2017 Best Paper Award, ChinaVis, 2016 Best Poster Honorable Mention, IEEE VIS, 2014 News 8/2023. Awarded by the NSF OAC on Collaborative Research: OAC Core: Topology-Aware Data Compression for Scientific Analysis and Visualization, in collaboration with Bei Wang Phillips (U. Utah) and Xin Liang (U. Kentucky) 7/2023. Awarded by the NSF CSSI Program for a $3.2M collaborative project together with University of Chicago, Indiana University, and University of Alabama at Birmingham 6/2022. Awarded by the DOE Early Career Research Program (ECRP) 6/2022. I will be joining the Department of Computer Science and Engineering at the Ohio State University in Fall 2022. I am looking for self-motivated Ph.D. students to join us in Spring/Autumn 2023.
